Question.question: What faculty is the BINFO program part of?
Question.option1: Faculty of Law, Economics and Finance
Question.option2: Faculty of Science, Technology and Medecine
Question.option3: Faculty of Humanities, Education and Social Sciences
Question.solution: BINFO program is part of the Faculty of Science, Technology and Medecine.

Question.question: What does BINFO's letters stand for?
Question.solution: Bachelor en INFOrmatique, those capital letters make BINFO.

Question.question: What program does BINFO actually represent?
Question.solution: There's a trap. The program changed its name during year 2019-2020 but the initials remained the same.

Question.question: How many semesters does the BINFO program contain?
Question.solution: 60 ECTS during 3 years which makes a total of 180 ECTS at the end of the Bachelor.

Question.question: How many ECTS is needed to a re-enrollment?
Question.solution: You'll need to validate at least 30 ECTS in the first school year. Of course, you can still retake the failed exam later in your studies.

Question.question: Where do BINFO students have class?
Question.solution: It used to be both in Belval and Kirchberg, back in the days.

Question.question: During which semester do you need to go on mobility?
Question.solution: The first year is a bit soon and you are already doing a internship in the last year so only option is during the second year.

Question.question: What skills do you need before even enrolling yourself?
Question.solution: But you need a high-school graduation though!

Question.question: What master can't be pursued after BINFO at Unilu?
Question.option1: Master in Information and Computer Sciences
Question.option3: Master in Information System Security Management
Question.solution: Master en Développement durable is part of Engineering cursus.

Question.question: What is the main language used in class?
Question.solution: English, and it is the best option regarding the diversity of UNILU students in general. There are some classes in french too.

Question.question: Who is in charge of BINFO program?
Question.solution: Prof. Dr.Müller is at the same time in charge of the program, and giving some classes in different semesters too.

Question.question: Who's BINFO's secretary?
Question.solution: Her office is in the 6th floor of MSA (Maison du Savoir).

Question.question: When was the university founded?
Question.solution: It was founded the 12th August 2003. It is the only public university in Luxembourg.

Question.question: How many students are there in Unilu?
Question.solution: Uni had 6400 students in 2017 and the number keeps increasing years after years.

Question.question: How many programs does the university propose (Bachelors and Masters)?
Question.solution: 11 Bachelors and 23 Masters for a total of 34 study programs.

Question.question: How many faculties are there in Unilu?
Question.solution: Faculties of [Law, Economics and Finance] [Science, Technology and Medecine] [Humanities, Education and Social Sciences].

Question.question: What does LLC stand for?
Question.solution: Inaugurated in 2018, LLC is offering so-called traditional library services as well as providing students with a state-of-the-art environment.

Question.question: How many countries/nationalities are represented in Unilu?
Question.solution: Unilu characteristic is its student diversity. Students come from border countries like France, Belgium and Germany as well as from many other countries.

Question.question: How many ECTS does the BINFO program contain?
Question.solution: A total of 180 ECTS would make you graduate from University and give you access to Masters either in Unilu or other universities.
